sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"相信，信任"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: belief, faith, confidence, conviction, credit, trust
means: belief ： 普通用词，指单纯从主观上的相信，不着重这种相信是否有根据。
faith ： 语气较强，强调完全相信；有时也能仅凭感觉产生的相信。
confidence ： 指对某人某事有充分信心，断定不会使人失望，因而给予信任。
conviction ： 多指根据长期交往或实践，对某人某事有了认识和了解后产生的信心和相信，侧重其坚定性。
credit ： 语气最弱，着重以声誉为信任的基础。
trust ： 强调相信、信任的完全可靠。

sentence.Network_en: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job.
sentence.Network_cn: 公众从来不相信他有能力胜任这一职位。

sentence.Network_en: Non-violence and patience are the central tenets of their faith.
sentence.Network_cn: 非暴力和忍耐是他们的信仰的核心原则。

sentence.Network_en: His government is placing its faith in international diplomacy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的政府对国际外交关系充满信心。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 不忠（或忠诚）；背叛（或忠实）

lj.lj_ly: an attempt to make us &B{break faith with} our customers.
lj.lj_ls: 让我们失信于顾客的企图。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French feid, from Latin fides

entry.def: If you have faith in someone or something, you feel confident about their ability or goodness.

example.ex: She had placed a great deal of faith in Mr Penleigh...
example.tran: 她对彭利先生极其信任。

example.ex: People have lost faith in the British Parliament.
example.tran: 人们已经对英国议会失去了信任。

entry.def: A faith is a particular religion, for example Christianity, Buddhism, or Islam.

example.ex: England shifted officially from a Catholic to a Protestant faith in the 16th century.
example.tran: 英格兰于 16 世纪正式由天主教改信新教。

entry.def: Faith is strong religious belief in a particular God.

example.ex: Umberto Eco's loss of his own religious faith is reflected in his novels.
example.tran: 翁贝托·艾柯个人宗教信仰的丧失反映在了他的小说里。

entry.def: If you break faith with someone you made a promise to or something you believed in, you stop acting in a way that supports them.

example.ex: If we don't, we're breaking faith with our people!
example.tran: 如果我们不这样，就是对我们的人民背信弃义！

entry.tran: 真诚地;真心实意地;好意地
entry.def: If you do something in good faith, you seriously believe that what you are doing is right, honest, or legal, even though this may not be the case.

example.ex: This report was published in good faith but we regret any confusion which may have been caused.
example.tran: 我们发表这篇报道的初衷是好的，但对可能已造成的混乱深感歉意。

entry.def: If you keep faith with someone you have made a promise to or something you believe in, you continue to support them even when it is difficult to do so.

example.ex: He has made one of the most powerful American films of the year by keeping faith with his radical principles.
example.tran: 他秉承自己一贯的激进风格，制作出了本年度美国最有感染力的影片之一。

means.word_mean: 1. a strong belief in a supernatural power or powers that control human destiny;

sentences.sentence: "he lost his faith but not his morality"

means.word_mean: 2. complete confidence in a person or plan etc;

sentences.sentence: "he cherished the faith of a good woman"
"the doctor-patient relationship is based on trust"

means.word_mean: 3. institution to express belief in a divine power;

sentences.sentence: "he was raised in the Baptist religion"
"a member of his own faith contradicted him"

means.word_mean: 4. loyalty or allegiance to a cause or a person;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But faith in leaders of all sides is low.

auth_sentence.content: Where there is doubt, may we bring faith.
auth_sentence.res_content: Where there is doubt, may we bring faith.

auth_sentence.res_content: I don't think that unshaken faith becomes religion.

stems_affixes.word_buile: faith信任,相信,信念→n.信任, 信念

Sentence.sentence: Its blind faith in traditional photography.

We must rely on the honesty and good faith of others, if not, we couldn't put money in the bank, buy food, clothing, or medicine from others, drive across a bridge, get on a plane, go to the dentist--the list is endless.

The savings and loan scandal, the stock market and junk bond swindles, and, of course, Watergate, have undermined the faith of many Americans in the integrity of political and economic leaders and society as a whole
Government bonds are a secure investment because these bonds have the financial backing and full faith and credit of the federal government.

means.word_mean: 信任; 信仰; 信心

sentences.en: Faith that justice would prevail impelled us forward.
sentences.cn: 正义必胜的信念激励着我们前进。

jushi.english: Have you any faith in what he says?
I've lost faith in that fellow.
jushi.chinese: 我再也不相信那个家伙了。

jushi.english: I haven't much faith in this medicine.
jushi.chinese: 我对这种药没有多大信心。
